You can't increase the ratio, but you can speed up the crawler. This
will a=
pply to the entire list of seeds.

When Heritrix makes requests from server=
s it times how long it takes
to receive a response, and then waits for that=
 period times by a
multiplier before requesting from the server again. If t=
his value is
below the min value, then it will wait the min value.

Under 1=
.12 you can change this multiplier (default I think was 4), and
change the =
min wait period. I'm sure these properties exist in sheets
for 2.0

While t=
his will allow you to speed up how fast Heritrix is crawling
websites. It w=
ill change the speed on all domains crawled listed in
your seeds. Servers p=
erforming deep database operations, and tasks
will take longer to respond. =
A robot that crawls a server quickly is
thought to be an "unfriendly" robot=
. Administrators tent to be pissed
at people to hit their servers to hard.
=

Servers most often feed pages to visitors who read the content,
request a =
few more pages, and then leave. Robots tent to perform deep
operating reque=
sts across the entire domain. Forcing database servers
to constantly update=
 their caches, and perform high order of queries.

So, while it might take =
your crawl job hours to complete. Go slowly,
take your time, and don't brak=
e your crawls down into small pieces. 

Practice friendly crawling.

P.S. S=
orry for the long post. :)
